name: NewYorker
text:
According to a group of experts, the potential for violent conflict around the 2020 election is high.
https://t.co/MYAvMU3bCU

name: NewYorker
text:
The first vice-president of the N.B.A. players’ union discusses how the players came to their decision to strike.
https://t.co/aWs66TfmNA

name: NewYorker
text:
As Joe Biden and Kamala Harris campaign for the future of our democracy this fall, they also have to lay the groundwork to fight for the future of our planet.
https://t.co/CqzqlkVjD3

name: NewYorker
text: Essential equations for life, by @lianafinck and @meganamram. https://t.co/Inlf5k7obP

name: NewYorker
text:
In February, a young Black man was shot by three white men while jogging. His killers were known. But it took 74 days for them to be arrested. #NewYorkerRadio
https://t.co/f8gCwZMCJY

name: NewYorker
text: As a farmworker, Winny Contreras has managed to save just enough to send his kids to college. The sacrifices that he has made along the way are intimately captured in the short documentary “Guanajuato Norte.” Watch here. https://t.co/Q6jjUwRFNb

name: NewYorker
text:
Even before the quarantine, Americans and Europeans spent about 90 per cent of their time indoors. Are better-designed buildings the solution to that which ails us?
 https://t.co/JiCBHDrkLz

name: NewYorker
text:
Almost precisely a year after assuring skittish voters that “nothing would fundamentally change” if he was elected, Joe Biden said that America was due for “some revolutionary institutional changes.” Read @eosnos’s Profile of the Presidential hopeful.
https://t.co/l7joUzhnjr

name: NewYorker
text: Two new podcasts look at the separate and unequal education in American public schools. https://t.co/rlgz6QMA6D

name: NewYorker
text: In the week before lockdown began, U.K. sales of plants, seeds, and bulbs were reportedly up 35 per cent from 2019. What is it about gardening that soothes us in bleak times? https://t.co/VipSiXAga3

name: NewYorker
text: Silvia Rosi photographs the work of the designer Grace Wales Bonner, whose clothing is “as disciplined as it is lush,” Hilton Als writes. https://t.co/ZkTbRv0FTB

name: NewYorker
text: Women perform the lion’s share of the vital care that we now call “essential” work. At the same time, since the start of the coronavirus pandemic, women have been laid off at an outsized rate. https://t.co/g7Zt0pgIsj

name: NewYorker
text: The U.S., with only four per cent of the world’s population, has more than 25 per cent of the world’s known COVID-19 cases. For the majority of them, the point of infection is unknown. https://t.co/XL4mKha9co

name: NewYorker
text: There’s a striking mix of normalcy and trauma in the new short documentary “Last Days at Paradise High,” which follows high schoolers in Paradise, California, after the devastating Camp Fire. Watch here. https://t.co/y2XbiedcD5

name: NewYorker
text: "I couldn’t help overhearing what Q and his pretty companion were saying to each other. It was a fairly complicated matter. I gave up trying to read and listened to them." Flash fiction by Haruki Murakami. https://t.co/zTA5X6EWPS

name: NewYorker
text:
The new documentary "Gatsby in Connecticut” is a valuable work of literary criticism in cinematic form, @tnyfrontrow writes.
https://t.co/Y6OvN1jndj
